column4: what part of my system do I edit to make 'umount' work via the drives eject button ?
what are u trying to do, eject your cd rom?
with the button?
yes like suse , mandriva and several other distros do
I have eject mapped to a button on my keyboard, the button on the drive doesnt work sometimes
how is this accomplished ?
in gnome, goto keyboard shortcuts and look for eject.  my keyboard has some extra multimedia keys I have volume and etc mapped out
did it work for you
sorry got busy with PM
checking
under sound > eject ???? ( I see no other eject mentioned)
yes
alright ..trying then

ok that worked although its a weird workaround and in 'sound' makes no sense...they need to move that elsewhere to make the option more visible maybe...but anyway I dont see why 'eject' can't be assigned to the 'button' on drive like some of the other distros do as its very user friendly and afterall that is market we are after...unless the devs feel somehow its bad design???
I dont understand it either - its in sound because of CDs - sometimes my button works, sometimes not.  I think it has something to do with ow the drive is mounted
drag the icon to the panel
how now that is a bit better and I did not realize that could be done..
not working
the only desktop icon I have atm..which is contents of cdrom
its not just the distro
you can make a launcher to eject the drive and put it on your panel.  the command is eject
youre making tooooooooooo much fuss about the eject button my friend
no i'm just discussing the merits as others are with me..if they ask I have the freedom to respond I believe
